value.title: Using Charticulator  for Replanting tree over Time in Different Region of New Zealand

value.title: What are the Use Cases of Dataflow for You in Power BI

value.title: What Happens to Your Job With the Revolution of Power BI and Self Service BI
value.excerpt: The job function, market, structure, and role definition in the world of Business Intelligence had big changes throughout the past few years. value.title: What is Premium Per User License for Power BI, and What is it good for
value.excerpt: One of the great news in Microsoft Ignite 2020 is the announcement of a new licensing plan for Microsoft Power BI, called Premium Per User, or Premium Gen2. In this article, I'll explain what that is, and how this can be helpful for Power BI users. Read my article here to find links to study more: https://radacad.com/what-is-premium-per-user-license-for-power-bi-and-what-is-it-good-for

value.title: What should be your Salary in 2020 if you work with Power BI
value.excerpt: The Power BI 2020 Salary survey was popular enough to get some interesting results. In this post, I am sharing the result of that survey (which is filled by the public) as a Power BI report. The report gives you an overall idea of how much the minimum, maximum, and average salary should be based on geo-location

value.title: Working with Records, Lists, and Values in Power BI Dataflows
value.excerpt: If you have been using dataflows, and you have the return value of a query as something which is not in the form of a table, such as a record, list, or value. then you have seen that the dataflow automatically converts them all to tables. There is an explanation about it, and a method around it. In this
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/M7dkx6uW4u4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. However, in DAX, if you have multiple IF THEN expressions, there is an easier way of doing it; using a function called SWITCH, this video is about how you can use switch function in DAX and Power BI

value.title: Writing calculations on a real time streaming Power BI dataset using DAX measures
value.excerpt: In the previous article and video, I explained a method that you can use to have real-time calculations in a Power BI streaming dataset. The calculations done that way are limited though because it is using the Q&A feature of Power BI. If you are after a complex calculation then DAX can definitely help.

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tONOosN1xAs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Applying color banding by document number in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use conditional formatting with a DAX expression to color the rows of a table in Power BI based on the order number instead of using the alternate rows color formatting option. Article and download: https://sql.bi/661744?aff=yt

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio

value.title: Deep dive into measure filters in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: In this video, we perform a deep analysis of the DAX queries generated by Power BI when you use a measure as a filter in a Power BI visual. The DAX code generated might show a different behavior whether the measure is part of the values shown in the visual or not.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/721618?aff=yt

value.title: Differences between INT and CONVERT in DAX
value.excerpt: How do you convert a DAX expression into an integer value? There are small differences between INT and CONVERT in DAX that may end up returning different results in arithmetic expressions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/742452?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Distinguishing HASONEVALUE from ISINSCOPE
value.excerpt: This video describes the differences between HASONEVALUE and ISINSCOPE, which are two useful DAX functions to control the filters and the grouping that are active in a report. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662962?aff=yt
